text: Yadollah Eslami was the editor in chief of Iranian newspaper Fath. Fath was shut down in 2000 after it had published an interview with Hussein-Ali Montazeri, and in January 2001 Eslami was convicted of publishing lies and anti-state propaganda. Fath was considered as the replacement of Khordad. ==References== Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Iranian journalists Category:Iranian editors Category:Iranian newspaper publishers (people) Category:People convicted of spreading propaganda against the system by the Islamic Republic of Iran
title: Yadollah Eslami
